page.title: 14LANREATH PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: Ten elected members form Lanreath {Parish Council,}which is a division of {Caradon District Council.}Parish Councils are strictly governed by the 1972 Local Government Act.In 1985/86 Â£379 was levied by a 1p rate.Lanreath P.C.chose not to be included in the register of "Areas of Outstanding Beauty",planning permission in these areas being very strictly considered. Lanreath P.C. has in the 1980s held the view that some development is required to sustain local amenities and social requirements.Election of Councillors is held every four years;the next being in 1987.The Chairman is elected annually.Members of the public are welcomed at the meetings,but take no part other than at the stipulated time.In 1984/5 street lights were installed at a cost of Â£1000.
